thread.title: Man shot by police now out of hospital
thread.title_full: Man shot by police now out of hospital - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: WCAX News
title: Man shot by police now out of hospital
text:
BURLINGTON, Vt. - The man who was shot by police officers in Colchester is out of the hospital.
Investigators say James Hemingway, 20, had a rifle and was threatening to shoot people at the Woodland Shores Mobile Home Park Sept. 20. After a lengthy standoff, police say Hemingway drove a car toward officers, stopped and got out of the car with a gun. That's when two Burlington police officers say they fired at him.
Hemingway was wounded in the abdomen and the foot.
Hemingway's arraignment on disorderly conduct and simple assault charges will likely be delayed for days while the state's attorney's office continues to review the case.
Related Stories:
Police ID cops who shot at Colchester man
BPD officers involved in Colchester shooting
